meanings.definition: In a wasteful or extravagant manner
meanings.sent1: She spent money profligately on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: The millionaire lived profligately, buying luxury cars and mansions.
meanings.sent3: Despite knowing she had limited funds, she profligately splurged on designer clothes.
meanings.sent4: The company profligately wasted resources on ineffective marketing strategies.
meanings.sent5: The child profligately poured out the entire bottle of bubbles in one go.

meanings.sent1: His profligately dishonest actions led to his downfall.
meanings.sent2: The profligately corrupt politician was finally exposed by the media.
meanings.sent3: The profligately deceitful character in the movie always had a hidden agenda.
meanings.sent4: The profligately unethical behavior of the CEO shocked the employees.
meanings.sent5: The profligately immoral scheme unraveled when evidence was uncovered.
